description: A winter island in the Grand Line, known for its medical expertise and cherry blossom farewell ceremony. Home to Dr. Kureha and formerly ruled by King Wapol.

keyEvents.title: Straw Hats Depart Drum Island
keyEvents.description: The Straw Hat Pirates sail away from Drum Island with Chopper, witnessing the cherry blossom effect as a farewell.
keyEvents.significance: Marks the conclusion of the Drum Island Arc and Chopper's departure from his homeland.

keyEvents.title: Kureha and Dalton's Conversation
keyEvents.description: Kureha and Dalton discuss the future of Drum Island and the meaning of Hiriluk's cherry blossoms.
keyEvents.significance: Provides closure to the Drum Island storyline and sets up Dalton's role in reforming the kingdom.

statusHistory.reason: Island remains inhabited and functioning after Wapol's defeat

description: The Straw Hat Pirates' first ship, a caravel given to them by Kaya. In this episode, it serves as the setting for Chopper's first full adventure with the crew as they sail toward Arabasta.

keyEvents.title: Crew Bonds with Chopper
keyEvents.description: The crew engages in bonding activities with Chopper on the Going Merry, including games, drinking, and singing.
keyEvents.significance: Shows the Going Merry as the home where Chopper begins to experience true friendship and belonging.

keyEvents.title: Toast to New Crewmate
keyEvents.description: The crew holds a toast on the Going Merry to celebrate Chopper officially joining as their doctor.
keyEvents.significance: The Going Merry witnesses the formal celebration of its sixth crew member.

keyEvents.title: Arabasta Mission Briefing
keyEvents.description: Vivi and Nami brief Chopper about the Arabasta situation and Baroque Works on the Going Merry.
keyEvents.significance: The ship serves as the strategic planning location for understanding the upcoming conflict.

keyEvents.title: Giant Bird Attacks
keyEvents.description: A giant bird attacks the Going Merry, grabbing Luffy before being defeated.
keyEvents.significance: The ship faces an aerial attack, providing action during the journey to Arabasta.

description: A prehistoric island in the Grand Line inhabited by dinosaurs and two warring giants. In this episode, it's shown as Mr. 2 Bon Kurei's location as he searches for Mr. 3.

keyEvents.title: Mr. 2 at Little Garden
keyEvents.description: Mr. 2 Bon Kurei is shown at Little Garden, punishing his navigator for failing to locate Mr. 3 before deciding to head to Arabasta.
keyEvents.significance: Shows Little Garden as a transitional location for Baroque Works agents moving toward the main conflict.
